author: Carlos Ramiro Chacín
title: Escándalo en Ucrania por lo que hizo una pareja en plena rueda de la fortuna
text:
Una curiosa escena fue vista en un parque de diversiones de Ucrania, cuando una pareja sostuvo relaciones sexuales en una rueda de la fortuna . Todo el hecho quedó grabado y se viralizó en las redes sociales.
Reportes en Internet indican que la pareja abordó una popular rueda de la fortuna. La pareja estaba a solas en una de las cabinas y todo parece indicar que, con el paso de los minutos, la situación subió de tono .
Otros visitantes del parque de diversiones se percataron de un movimiento extraño en una de las cabinas. Cuando afinaron su vista, vieron a la pareja teniendo relaciones sexuales , a pesar de que los vidrios no eran oscuros.
GRABARON A LA PAREJA De acuerdo a la denuncia, los visitantes grabaron a la distancia a la pareja mientras tenía relaciones sexuales. Luego entregaron las imágenes a la policía , la cual puso en marcha una investigación sobre el caos.
Hasta el momento, se desconoce si las autoridades ucranianas lograron identificar a la pareja que estaba en la cabina. Tampoco hay información sobre los avances de la investigación o si hay detenidos.
TAMBIÉN TE PUEDE INTERESAR: EN VIDEO: LA ATERRADORA EXPERIENCIA DE UN OBRERO QUE IBA A SER APLASTADO POR UNA GRÚA Y LO QUE HIZO PARA SALVARSE El video se filtró en redes sociales y ya cuenta con decenas de miles de reproducciones . Los internautas quedaron sorprendidos por el video y no se hicieron esperar los chistes sobre la pareja.
«Qué mente tan morbosa, siempre pensando mal, no ven que le estaba dando masajes porque le dio calambre », dijo un internauta, mientras que otros hicieron bromas respecto al estado de guerra que vive Ucrania tras la invasión rusa.

Aspirin Inhibits Metastatic Cancer Spread, Reducing Mortality by 21 Percent: Study
Aspirin is a long-established and widely used medication with a rich history. In addition to its well-known uses for pain relief and its anti-inflammatory and anticoagulant properties, a recent study indicates that cancer patients who take low-dose aspirin daily experience a 21 percent reduction in mortality. Furthermore, there is evidence of aspirin’s role in preventing cancer metastasis.
Cancer is one of the leading causes of global mortality. In 2020 alone, there were approximately 19.3 million new cancer cases worldwide and nearly 10 million deaths. According to statistics, 1 in 6 reported deaths are attributed to cancer. The most common types of cancer include breast, lung, colorectal, prostate, and stomach.
In November 2023, researchers from Cardiff University in the United Kingdom published a comprehensive review in the British Journal of Cancer (BJC) outlining aspirin’s potential to reduce cancer mortality, prevent metastatic cancer spread, and minimize vascular complications. The review encompassed both favorable and unfavorable evidence, thoroughly analyzing the rationale behind using aspirin in cancer treatment.
Aspirin’s Impact on Cancer Mortality
The study compiled results from 118 observational studies involving approximately 1 million cancer patients. It revealed that daily intake of low-dose aspirin (75 or 81 milligrams) was associated with a 21 percent reduction in all-cause mortality.

author: Rafia Tasleem
title: Racing for a Sustainable Future: The Pangong Frozen Lake Marathon
text:
Imagine the crunch of snow underfoot, the crisp air filling your lungs, and the stunning vista of the Himalayas surrounding you as you embark on one of the most unique marathons in the world. On February 20, the frozen expanse of Pangong Lake in Ladakh will host a marathon unlike any other, aimed at drawing global attention to the pressing issue of climate change and its impact on Himalayan glaciers. This event, limited to a select 50 runners, promises not only an unparalleled athletic challenge but also a powerful statement on environmental sustainability.
A Race Against Time
The Pangong Frozen Lake Marathon, now in its second edition, is more than just a test of endurance; it's a clarion call to the world about the fragility of our natural environment. Organized by the Adventure Sports Foundation of Ladakh, in collaboration with the Tourism Department and Ladakh administration, the marathon seeks to shed light on the significant effects climate change has on the region's glaciers. The organizers have taken painstaking measures to ensure the event is conducted sustainably, banning the use of plastic water bottles and any waste-generating products, a move that sets a new standard for eco-friendly athletic events.
Champions of Sustainability
This marathon stands as a testament to human will and the power of collective action in the face of environmental challenges. By registering the event in the Guinness Book of World Records as the World’s Highest Frozen Lake Half Marathon, the organizers aim not only to highlight the athletic feat but also to underscore the urgent need for sustainable practices. The inclusion of both full and half marathons on the icy course of Pangong Lake offers participants of all abilities the opportunity to contribute to this vital cause, under the watchful eyes of a dedicated medical team and with the support of hot water points strategically located throughout the course.
A Leap for Winter Tourism and Global Awareness
The marathon is more than an athletic event; it's a beacon for winter tourism in Ladakh, showcasing the beauty and challenges of the region during the colder months. By promoting environmentally sustainable tourism, the marathon hopes to inspire a shift in how visitors engage with fragile ecosystems, encouraging a deeper understanding and respect for the natural world. As runners from around the globe lace up their shoes to tackle the frozen expanse of Pangong Lake, they will also be spreading a message of hope and resilience, demonstrating that even in the most extreme conditions, humanity can come together to celebrate the beauty of our planet and take meaningful steps to protect it.
In the end, the Pangong Frozen Lake Marathon is more than a race; it’s an emblem of hope, a challenge to the status quo, and a reminder of the beauty and fragility of our natural world. As these 50 runners set forth on their journey across the ice, they carry with them not just the aspirations of athletes but the collective hope for a sustainable future. This event encapsulates the essence of human endurance, the urgent need for environmental stewardship, and the unyielding spirit of adventure that defines the best of our endeavors.
